wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Herbert Procter VC (11 August 1890 – 27 January 1973) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Reverend Arthur Herbert Procter, Victoria Cross recipient, was Curate at St Mary's Church from 1927 to 1931.Crockfords Clerical Directory for 1931 OUP (1931) p1059
Rev Arthur Herbert Procter, Victoria Cross recipient, was Rector of St Mary's parish church from 1946 to 1951. A Blue Plaque is at the church.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Arthur Herbert Procter || British Army || 1916 || First World War || Ficheux
*Arthur Herbert Procter (1890–1973), Victoria Cross recipient, educated in Port Sunlight
